title.narrative: OPT 2.5. SUPPORTING ACCESS TO CONTINUOUS

description.narrative: SUPPORTING ACCESS TO CONTINUOUS EDUCATION UNDER COVID19 EMERGENCY, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement (Covid), Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, children and adolescents, especially the most disadvantaged, have increased access to, learning and completion of quality education services, including in emergency situations.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: SUPPORTING ACCESS TO CONTINUOUS EDUCATION UNDER COVID19 EMERGENCY

description.narrative: Safe Return to School measures implemented nationwide have been anchored to the guiding principles developed by UNICEF, UNESCO and WFP in 2020 and later endorsed by the Ministry of Educationunder adocument of Key Considerations for Decision Makers. As a result, a total of 50,130 students (24,602 male and 25,528 female) returned to school after the COVID-19 restrictions, restoring their right to education through three educational modalities established though Ministerial Resolution 001/2021 in UNICEF targeted municipalities. 576 schools and preschools were equipped with biosecurity materials to implement protocols and plans to prevent the transmission of COVID-19 in schools. | Status:Met | As-of Date:22/12/2021
